articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. and Ukraine have agreed on the terms of a draft minerals deal central to Kyiv's push to win Washington's support as President Donald Trump seeks to rapidly end the war with Russia, two sources with knowledge of the matter said on Tuesday.
articles.title: US, Ukraine agree to terms of critical minerals deal

articles.author: Emma Farge
articles.description: Dozens of countries rallied behind Ukraine at a meeting at the United Nations in Geneva on Tuesday, a day after the U.N. Security Council adopted a U.S.-drafted resolution that takes a neutral stance on the conflict.
articles.title: Countries tell Ukraine 'you are not alone' after UN adopts neutral stance on war

articles.author: James Mackenzie, Andrew Mills
articles.description: Israel is considering an extension of the 42-day truce in Gaza as it seeks to bring home the remaining 63 hostages, while putting off agreement on the future of the enclave for now, Israeli officials said.
articles.title: Israel looks to extend phase one of Gaza truce as long-term deal proves elusive

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump's approval rating held steady over the past week, according to a Reuters/Ipsos poll released on Tuesday that found 44% of respondents approved of his performance over his first month in office.
articles.title: Trump approval rating holds steady at 44%, Reuters/Ipsos poll finds

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Eastern and Southern African countries are looking into the possibility of deploying troops to secure areas of eastern Democratic Republic of Congo now under M23 rebel control, according to a document seen by Reuters on Tuesday.
articles.title: Eastern and Southern African blocs weigh deployment to eastern Congo

articles.author: William James
articles.description: Europe should move from freezing Russian assets to seizing them, British foreign minister David Lammy said on Tuesday, hardening Britain's position on how the West should use bonds and other securities frozen since Russia's invasion of Ukraine.
articles.title: It's time to seize Russian assets, not just freeze them, says UK's Lammy

articles.author: Juliette Jabkhiro
articles.description: The son of a retired French surgeon accused of raping and sexually assaulting hundreds of young patients told a court on Tuesday that Joel Le Scouarnec was a good father - but that the crimes he is accused of are unforgivable.
articles.title: In retired French surgeon's child rape trial, son says father was like 'Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde'

articles.author: Crispian Balmer, Joshua McElwee
articles.description: Pope Francis, battling double pneumonia, remains in critical condition for the fourth day running but is stable and has not had any further respiratory crises, the Vatican said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Pope Francis in critical condition for fourth day running, but stable, Vatican says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer and French President Emmanuel Macron said on Tuesday they welcomed U.S. President Donald Trump's leadership in working towards a durable peace in Ukraine.
articles.title: UK's Starmer, France's Macron welcome Trump's work towards durable peace in Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A federal judge on Tuesday blocked President Donald Trump's effort to indefinitely suspend the U.S. refugee resettlement program.
articles.title: US judge blocks Trump's indefinite suspension of refugee resettlement program
